summary.long: 2 Thessalonians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text:
Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy,
To the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We must always give thanks to God for you, brothers and sisters, as is right, because your faith is growing abundantly and the love of every one of you for one another is increasing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore we ourselves boast of you among the churches of God for your steadfastness and faith during all your persecutions and the afflictions that you are enduring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is evidence of the righteous judgment of God and is intended to make you worthy of the kingdom of God, for which you are also suffering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is indeed just of God to repay with affliction those who afflict you
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to give relief to the afflicted as well as to us, when the Lord Jesus is revealed from heaven with his mighty angels
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in a fiery flame, inflicting vengeance on those who do not know God and on those who do not obey the gospel of our Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These will suffer the punishment of eternal destruction, separated from the presence of the Lord and from the glory of his might,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when he comes to be glorified by his saints and to be marveled at on that day among all who have believed, because our testimony to you was believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To this end we always pray for you, asking that our God will make you worthy of his call and will fulfill by his power every good resolve and work of faith,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the name of our Lord Jesus may be glorified in you and you in him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As to the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and our being gathered together to him, we beg you, brothers and sisters,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not to be quickly shaken in mind or alarmed, either by spirit or by word or by letter, as though from us, to the effect that the day of the Lord is already here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no one deceive you in any way, for that day will not come unless the rebellion comes first and the lawless one is revealed, the one destined for destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He opposes and exalts himself above every so-called god or object of worship, so that he takes his seat in the temple of God, declaring himself to be God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not remember that I told you these things when I was still with you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you know what is now restraining him, so that he may be revealed when his time comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the mystery of lawlessness is already at work, but only until the one who now restrains it is removed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then the lawless one will be revealed, whom the Lord Jesus will destroy with the breath of his mouth, annihilating him by the manifestation of his coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The coming of the lawless one is apparent in the working of Satan, who uses all power, signs, lying wonders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and every kind of wicked deception for those who are perishing because they refused to love the truth and so be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason God sends them a powerful delusion, leading them to believe what is false,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that all who have not believed the truth but took pleasure in unrighteousness will be condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we must always give thanks to God for you, brothers and sisters beloved by the Lord, because God chose you as the first fruits for salvation through sanctification by the Spirit and through belief in the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this purpose he called you through our gospel, so that you may obtain the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, brothers and sisters, stand firm and hold fast to the traditions that you were taught by us, either by word of mouth or by our letter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now may our Lord Jesus Christ himself and God our Father, who loved us and through grace gave us eternal comfort and good hope,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: comfort your hearts and strengthen them in every good work and word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, brothers and sisters, pray for us, so that the word of the Lord may spread rapidly and be glorified everywhere, just as it is among you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that we may be rescued from wicked and evil people, for not all have faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord is faithful; he will strengthen you and guard you from the evil one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we have confidence in the Lord concerning you, that you are doing and will go on doing the things that we command.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the Lord direct your hearts to the love of God and to the steadfastness of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we command you, brothers and sisters, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, to keep away from every brother or sister living irresponsibly and not according to the tradition that they received from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you yourselves know how you ought to imitate us; we were not irresponsible when we were with you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and we did not eat anyone’s bread without paying for it, but with toil and labor we worked night and day so that we might not burden any of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was not because we do not have that right but in order to give you an example to imitate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even when we were with you, we gave you this command: anyone unwilling to work should not eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we hear that some of you are living irresponsibly, mere busybodies, not doing any work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now such persons we command and exhort in the Lord Jesus Christ to do their work quietly and to earn their own living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers and sisters, do not be weary in doing what is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take note of those who do not obey what we say in this letter; have nothing to do with them, so that they may be ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not regard them as enemies, but admonish them as brothers and sisters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now may the Lord of peace himself give you peace at all times in all ways. The Lord be with all of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, Paul, write this greeting with my own hand. This is the mark in every letter of mine; it is the way I write.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with all of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
